intro: Leucopsis calendulacea, commonly known as the yellow dandelion, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant features a basal rosette of lobed, hairy leaves and produces bright yellow flowers that develop into fluffy, wind-dispersed seeds. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and gardens. Leucopsis calendulacea is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally for its diuretic and anti-inflammatory effects.
